articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description:
Kinda silly sounding, isn‚Äôt it? CSS database queries. But, hey, CSS is capable of talking to other languages in the sense that it can set the values of things that they can read. Plus, CSS can request other files, and ‚Ä¶
CSS Database Queries? Sure We Can! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Stimac)
articles.description: Dual-screen devices are just the next evolution in responsive design. If you have a PWA or website, the APIs available make integrating into your existing code base seamless. This article explains why it‚Äôs an exciting time for layout on the web, and how dual screens provide an opportunity to get even more creative.
articles.title: Building Web Layouts For Dual-Screen And Foldable Devices

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: What started as a case study turned into a guide to visualizing audio with JavaScript. Although the output demos are in React, Jhey Tompkins isn‚Äôt going to dwell on the React side of things too much. The underlying techniques work with or without React.
articles.title: A Guide To Audio Visualization With JavaScript And GSAP (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: 2022 is shaping up to be a pretty great year for CSS, with a plethora of new features on the horizon. Some are already starting to land in browsers, others are likely to gain widespread browser support in 2022, while for one or two the process may be a little longer. In this article we‚Äôll take a look at a few of them.
articles.title: New CSS Features In 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: As a design community, we all can‚Äôt be silent in these times. We need to be united in our fight against the war, for democracy, for those dreams that children are entitled to have when they are growing up. It‚Äôs our obligation to help as much as we can. **We are donating all proceeds** from "Interface Design Checklists" PDF to support Ukraine.
articles.title: We All Are Ukraine üá∫üá¶

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Following our monthly tradition, artists and designers from across the globe challenged their creative skills and designed desktop wallpapers to welcome March. They come in versions with and without a calendar and can be downloaded for free.
articles.title: March For Equality (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (√Åtila Fassina)
articles.description: Maintaining a design system is a lot of work. In this article, Atila Fassina shares his lessons learned and how a platform such as Backlight can help put together a series of tools to speed up your architecture setup.
articles.title: A Recipe For A Good Design System

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (√Åtila Fassina)
articles.description: Web Vitals are the new gold standard in performance due to their direct correlation with the user‚Äôs experience. In this article, you‚Äôll learn what monitoring can do and how RayGun can help you sustain performance maintenance while scaling your app.
articles.title: How To Benchmark And Improve Web Vitals With Real User Metrics

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: If we want our WordPress plugins to offer a settings page that is fully powered by blocks, how can we do it? Since *Full Site Editing* doesn‚Äôt support this feature yet, we need to code a custom solution. In this article, we will learn how we can do it.
articles.title: Using The WordPress Editor And CPTs To Configure Plugins

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ilya Medvedev)
articles.description: How do text typing and editing work on the web? Although this process might seem straightforward, there is a lot of technical nuance behind its apparent simplicity. This article looks at how typing on the web works.
articles.title: How To Develop A Text Editor For The Web

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we‚Äôre talking about Responsible JavaScript. What does it mean for code to be responsible, and how should we approach projects differently? Drew McLellan talks to expert Jeremy Wagner to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 45 With Jeremy Wagner: What Is Responsible JavaScript?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)
articles.description: You don‚Äôt need to be a full DevOps engineer if you want to introduce a testing build routine. With the help of some testing frameworks and GitHub actions, Ramona Schwering gives a short kick-off to help you get on the right track.
articles.title: Testing Pipeline 101 For Frontend Testing

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Knut Melv√¶r)
articles.description: Markdown in all its flavors, interpretations, and forks won‚Äôt go away. However, it‚Äôs important to look at emerging content formats that try to encompass modern needs. In this article, Knut shares his advice against Markdown by looking back on why it was introduced in the first place, and by going through some of the major developments of content on the web.
articles.title: Thoughts On Markdown

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: We all need a little inspiration boost every now and again. In this post, we collected inspiring resources from all across the web for you ‚Äî beautiful eye candy, tips to challenge your skills, and useful tools that are bound to spark new ideas. Enjoy!
articles.title: Falling In Love With The Web: Inspiring Websites And Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: In this article, Leonardo Losoviz discusses some potential consequences as well as positive outcomes of WordPress joining the Block Protocol.
articles.title: Implications Of WordPress Joining The Block Protocol

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich & Gleb Kuznetsov)
articles.description: Voice is a powerful tool that we can use to communicate with each other. This article covers the most critical aspects of designing for voice user interfaces: designing the conversation and designing visual interfaces.
articles.title: Everything You Want To Know About Creating Voice User Interfaces

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederick O‚ÄôBrien)
articles.description: This installment of *Web Design Done Well* celebrates weird and wacky websites. Sites with sweet, innocent, sometimes pointless purposes. Are they money makers? Game changers? Not necessarily, but they sure are fun, and in ways only the web could really manage.
articles.title: Web Design Done Well: Perfectly Pointless

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Steven Hoober)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sergey Melukov)
articles.description: Statoscope is an instrument that analyses your webpack-bundles. Created by Sergey Melukov, it started out as an experimental version in late 2016, which has now become a full-fledged toolkit for viewing, analyzing, and validating webpack-bundles.
articles.title: Statoscope: A Course Of Intensive Therapy For Your Bundle

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stanislav Khrustalev)
articles.description: While QR codes have many uses and can be leveraged at many touch points, they are just one of dozens of technologies that can improve the customer‚Äôs journey. Stanislav Khrustalev shares his advice with a list of things to keep in mind when using QR codes for your business.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noam Rosenthal)

articles.title: What Web Frameworks Solve: The Vanilla Alternative (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: In this article, we‚Äôll look specifically at what we can do to reduce the impact of social media embeds and social sharing widgets ‚Äî or even some strategies to avoid them altogether. While the spotlight is on reducing the environmental impact, many of these tips will be great for performance too.

articles.title: How to Build and Deploy a Backend App with Express, Postgres, Github, and Heroku

articles.title: Redux Tutorial for Beginners
